info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 10 at 6:41PM PDT until October 10 at 9:45PM PDT by NWS Las Vegas NV
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southern Nevada, including the following county, Clark.
* WHEN...Until 945 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 640 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Las Vegas, North Las Vegas, Fremont Street, Nellis AFB, Aliante, East Las Vegas, The Strip, The Motor Speedway, Paradise, Lone Mountain, Spring Valley, Centennial Hills, Summerlin, North Las Vegas Airport, Stratosphere Tower and Frenchman Mtn. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM PDT THIS EVENING
